    • Method Detail

      • detachFactory

        public void detachFactory()
        Make this object independent of shared resources from its factory. In particular, the captive ByteArrayOutputStream is no longer linked to the factory (and thereby shared with other codecs produced by the factory).

      • loadDocument

        public void loadDocument(T doc)
        Load a document into the codec. The document is typically in a navigable form such as a Map or List.

      • loadImage

        public abstract void loadImage(byte[] docImage)
        Load a document into the codec from a serialized image. A codec that doesn't have a binary format may throw an exception for this method.

      • loadString

        public void loadString(String docJson)
        Load a document into the code from JSON text.

      • loadUnicode

        public void loadUnicode(byte[] docUnicode)
        Load a document into the codec from JSON Unicode text.

      • setKeyPath

        public void setKeyPath(String[] keySteps)
        Set the path to a unique key for the document, as a series of step strings. May be null to disable. This automatically clears any rekeying settings.

      • setValidation

        public void setValidation(boolean validate)
        If set to true, this requests a full validation of the JSON during key extraction. Otherwise, the parse will terminate as soon as the key is found.

      • getKey

        public String getKey(boolean needViable)
              throws jakarta.json.JsonException
        Get the value for the key as a string. Returns null if the key is not present, or is unviable for use by SODA. If needViable is true, this will throw an exception if an unviable key is discovered.
        Throws:
        jakarta.json.JsonException

      • setRemoveKey

        public void setRemoveKey(boolean removeKey)
                  throws jakarta.json.JsonException
        If true, remove the existing key from the document. If the key is not present in the document, does nothing. Use removeKey = true together with setNewKey() if you want to force a new key to be used in the document.
        Throws:
        jakarta.json.JsonException

      • generateEJSONId

        public void generateEJSONId(boolean val)

      • setNewKey

        public void setNewKey(String key)
               throws jakarta.json.JsonException
        Request that the document key set be to the specified string. To be sure of removing an existing key, combine this with removeKey() otherwise setNewKey will only operate if a key is not already found.
        Throws:
        jakarta.json.JsonException

      • setNewKey

        public void setNewKey(String key,
                      boolean isIdentifier)
               throws jakarta.json.JsonException
        Request that the document key be set to the specified string. If isIdentifier = true, requests that the string be treated as an internal identifier for the document format. This will typically be either an ObjectId or UUID. For textual JSON isIdentifier has no effect, and keys are stored "as-is" as strings. For binary formats, the conversion to identifier will depend on the length of the key string.
        Throws:
        jakarta.json.JsonException

      • setNewKey

        public void setNewKey(String key,
                      boolean isIdentifier,
                      boolean mustMatch)
        Set a new key for a document, optionally as an identifier. If mustMatch = true, requires that if an old key is present in the document, it must be a match to the new key. This allows a caller to ensure a key value is present, but without forcibly replacing an existing key with a different value. An exception is thrown if the keys don't match.

      • getDocument

        public abstract T getDocument()
                       throws jakarta.json.JsonException
        Return the document as a navigable (DOM-like) object. For some codecs this may return null, though typically codecs will offer something resembling the Java Map or List constructs.
        Throws:
        jakarta.json.JsonException

      • getImage

        public abstract byte[] getImage()
                         throws jakarta.json.JsonException
        Return the document as a serialized binary image. A codec that doesn't have a binary format will throw an exception.
        Throws:
        jakarta.json.JsonException

      • getString

        public String getString()
                 throws jakarta.json.JsonException
        Return the document as JSON text. This may require a lossy translation of a document that has extended semantics in DOM or binary image form.
        Throws:
        jakarta.json.JsonException

      • getUnicode

        public byte[] getUnicode()
                  throws jakarta.json.JsonException
        Return the document as JSON text in Unicode UTF-8 format. This may require a lossy translation of a document that has extended semantics in DOM or binary image form.
        Throws:
        jakarta.json.JsonException

      • getDocument

        public Object getDocument(Class clazz)
                   throws jakarta.json.JsonException
        Throws:
        jakarta.json.JsonException

      • bigDecimalToKey

        public static String bigDecimalToKey(BigDecimal bval)
        Convert a numeric key to the simplest string form. Typically, this is to a simple integer.
